summary: The concept of "national school" pertains to educational institutions established and regulated under the jurisdiction of individual EU Member States. These schools are integral to the national education systems, providing foundational teaching and learning experiences aligned with national curricula. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, national schools must comply with directives that promote educational standards, inclusivity, and accessibility. They play a crucial role in fostering a skilled workforce, contributing to the EU's overarching goals of social cohesion and economic growth. Furthermore, national schools often collaborate with EU initiatives aimed at enhancing educational quality across borders.
